title._content: [Dudley Leavitt Pickman, Jr., house, 213 Hale Street, Beverly, Massachusetts. (LOC)

description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. [Dudley Leavitt Pickman, Jr., house, 213 Hale Street, Beverly, Massachusetts. Fountain basin] [1926] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide, hand-colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: Site History. House Architecture: Little & Browne, alterations to existing house, 1899-1900. Landscape: Little & Browne, 1899-1900. Other: This garden won an award for "outdoor living-room" garden from the Massachusetts Horticultural Society, 1926. Today: Garden not extant. On slide: Unprinted paper mask has the type of gold-border boxes used by slide manufacturer T.H. McAllister-Keller Co., Inc. Title, date, and subject information provided by Sam Watters, 2011. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Published in Gardens for a Beautiful America / Sam Watters. New York: Acanthus Press, 2012. Plate 24. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16788 Call Number: LC-J717-X108- 61
